radiographic_examinations.findings: Fluid-filled and mildly dilated appendix measuring 8 mm with associated hyperemia of the walls, mild surrounding fat stranding; imaged lung bases clear without pulmonary nodules or pleural effusions; normal heart and pericardium; liver enhances homogeneously without focal lesions; normal gallbladder, kidneys enhancing and excreting contrast without hydronephrosis; normal adrenal glands, spleen, pancreas; normal abdominal aorta; no significant retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy; normal stomach, small and large bowel; urinary bladder and distal ureters normal; trace pelvic free fluid within physiologic range; normal rectum and sigmoid colon; 2.1 cm left adnexal cyst within physiologic range; no bone lesions suspicious for infection or malignancy; severe levoconvex scoliosis of the lumbar spine, with sacralization of the fifth lumbar vertebra.
